page.title: 18CHANGES IN CHARLTON (2)
page.content: The Village Hall that we have got at the moment used to be a wheelwrights. It was an old barn. At one time it was a blacksmiths shop. In 1800 the chapel was built. They got the stone from an old field and it's still used now. It cost one thousand, three hundred and fifty pounds to be built. There is a person who delivers the milk to us and he lives across the road from the Rectory.He gets his milk from Elm Farm Dairy in Kidlington.He can't get it from Charlton any more because there are not any Dairy farms. At one time there was a Butchers,Sweet shop,Shoe shop and a slaughter house.
